answers.q: how to put on atlas snowshoes electra e927
answers.a: E927 is a food-additive code, not gear; it covers azodicarbonamide (E927a), a flour treatment/bleaching agent, and carbamide/urea (E927b), used mainly in chewing gum.
That refers to carbamide (urea), designated E927b, a food additive used mainly in chewing gum; E927a, by contrast, is azodicarbonamide, a flour treatment agent.

answers.q: what is the difference between a es927 and a e927 raymarine
answers.a: In food labeling, E927a is azodicarbonamide (a flour treatment/oxidizing agent; not permitted in the EU but allowed at low levels in the U.S.), while E927b is carbamide/urea, used mainly in chewing gum.

answers.q: what is the difference between a raymarine es927 and a e927
answers.a: For the E-number system, E927a denotes azodicarbonamide (flour treatment/bleaching agent), and E927b denotes carbamide/urea (used primarily in chewing gum); they are different substances with different uses and regulatory status.
